dependencies.description:
ATK provides the set of accessibility interfaces that are implemented by
other toolkits and applications. Using the ATK interfaces, accessibility
tools have full access to view and control running applications.
dependencies.name: atk

dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools
dependencies.name: autoconf

dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools
dependencies.name: automake

dependencies.description:
The Gdk Pixbuf is a toolkit for image loading and pixel buffer
manipulation. It is used by GTK+ 2 and GTK+ 3 to load and manipulate
images. In the past it was distributed as part of GTK+ 2 but it was
split off into a separate package in preparation for the change to GTK+
3.
dependencies.name: gdk-pixbuf

dependencies.description:
GLib provides the core application building blocks for libraries and
applications written in C. The GLib package contains a low-level
libraries useful for providing data structure handling for C,
portability wrappers and interfaces for such runtime functionality as an
event loop, threads, dynamic loading and an object system.
dependencies.name: glib

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description:
The GObject Introspection is used to describe the program APIs and
collect them in a uniform, machine readable format.Cairo is a 2D
graphics library with support for multiple output
dependencies.name: gobject-introspection

dependencies.description:
The GTK+ package contains libraries used for creating graphical user
interfaces for applications.
dependencies.name: gtkplus

dependencies.description:
Musl is a libc, an implementation of the standard library functionality
described in the ISO C and POSIX standards, plus common extensions,
intended for use on Linux-based systems. Whereas the kernel (Linux)
governs access to hardware, memory, filesystems, and the privileges for
accessing these resources, the C library is responsible for providing
the actual C function interfaces userspace applications see, and for
constructing higher-level buffered stdio, memory allocation management,
thread creation and synchronization operations, and so on using the
lower-level interfaces the kernel provides, as well as for implementing
pure library routines of the C language like strstr, snprintf, strtol,
exp, sqrt, etc. Musl is a new general-purpose implementation of the C
library. It is lightweight, fast, simple, free, and aims to be correct
in the sense of standards-conformance and safety.
dependencies.name: iconv

dependencies.description:
intltool is a set of tools to centralize translation of many different
file formats using GNU gettext-compatible PO files.
dependencies.name: intltool

dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.
dependencies.name: libtool

dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.
dependencies.name: libxml2

dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.
dependencies.name: m4

dependencies.description:
Pango is a library for laying out and rendering of text, with an
emphasis on internationalization. It can be used anywhere that text
layout is needed, though most of the work on Pango so far has been done
in the context of the GTK+ widget toolkit.
dependencies.name: pango

dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.
dependencies.name: pkgconfig

description:
GtkSourceView is a GNOME library that extends GtkTextView, the standard
GTK+ widget for multiline text editing. GtkSourceView adds support for
syntax highlighting, undo/redo, file loading and saving, search and
replace, a completion system, printing, displaying line numbers, and
other features typical of a source code editor.
name: gtksourceview

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
